title: Old-age dependency ratio by state and union territory in India 2011
summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
There is a difference of 9.2 between the maximum State And Union Territory Kerala and minimum State And Union Territory Delhi.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The Old-age dependency ratio is appeared to be the highest at State And Union Territory Kerala and lowest at State And Union Territory Delhi.
There is a difference of 9.2 between the maximum State And Union Territory Kerala and minimum State And Union Territory Delhi.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing State And Union Territory in the x axis and Old-age dependency ratio in the y axis.
The maximum Old-age dependency ratio 19.6 is found at State And Union Territory Kerala and the minimum is found at Delhi where State And Union Territory is 10.4.
The difference of Old-age dependency ratio between the highest and lowest State And Union Territory is 9.2.
The State And Union Territory Kerala has the highest Old-age dependency ratio, followed by Punjab, and Tamil Nadu. Down to the State And Union Territory Delhi which is the lowest.
Similar Old-age dependency ratio is found in State And Union Territory Andaman & Nicobar Islands, and Odisha.
The average Old-age dependency ratio in all 20 State And Union Territorys is 14.09.
Summing up the values of all State And Union Territorys, we get total 281.8.
